intro: Galium qaradaghense, commonly known as the Qaradagh bedstraw, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that disperse seeds by wind. Galium qaradaghense is adapted to rocky and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
